WSS, Wednus Styling System

Detailed Description

The implementation of the WSS, Wednus Styling System.

Variables

W style
 Apply styling.

Variable Documentation

W style
 

Initial value:

 function(obj, wss){
    if(typeof wss == 'undefined') return -1;
    
    wss = wss.split('|');
    if(wss[0] != '')
        applyChange(wss[0], false);
    if(typeof wss[1] != 'undefined')
        applyChange(wss[1], true);

    function applyChange(wss, isStyle){
        var tmp, latestProp, target;
        if(isStyle){
            target = obj.style;
        }else target = obj;

        var styles = wss.split(';');
        for(var i = 0; i < styles.length; ++i){
            tmp = styles[i].split(':');
            if(typeof tmp[1] == 'undefined'){
                
                target[tmp[0]] = latestProp;
            }else target[tmp[0]] = latestProp = tmp[1];
        }
    };

    return obj;
}
Apply styling.

apply property/style change 

 obj.id = 'myObj';
 obj.border = '3px';
 obj.style.top = '10px';
 obj.style.left = '12px';
 obj.style.width = '100%';
 obj.style.height = '100%';
 obj.style.position = 'absolute';
This block of code can be written in one line. 
 W.style(obj, 'id:myObj;border:3px|top:10px;left:12px;width:100%;height;position:absolute');
notice the part 'height;'. When there is no value specified, WSS uses the latest value used. for example, 
 obj.style.top = '100px';
 obj.style.left = '100px';
 obj.style.width = '100px';
 obj.style.height = '100px';
can be reduced as: 
 W.style(obj, '|top:100px;left;width;height');
Warning:
If you have registered an object on WPS changing top/left/width/height will not give any effect, since WPS manages those property of the object once it become registered.
Parameters:
obj the target object
wss WSS(Wednus Styling System) valid string value
Returns:
object after style application
